definition: Life-threatening thrombotic microangiopathy from severe ADAMTS13 deficiency or inhibition leading to ultra-large vWF multimers, platelet-rich microthrombi, thrombocytopenia, and microangiopathic hemolytic anemia with organ ischemia.

images.alt: TTP with platelet microthrombi due to ADAMTS13 deficiency

why_it_matters: Emergency; mortality falls with rapid plasma exchange. PT/PTT are usually normal, which helps separate TTP from DIC.
how_youll_see_it: Adult (often female) with petechiae or purpura and neurologic changes such as headache or confusion.
Hemolysis signs: jaundice or dark urine; smear with schistocytes; high LDH and low haptoglobin.
Thrombocytopenia with normal PT and PTT.
problem_solving: Treat immediately when microangiopathic hemolytic anemia plus thrombocytopenia and normal PT/PTT; do not wait for ADAMTS13 assay.
Avoid platelet transfusions unless life-threatening bleeding.
Common triggers: autoantibodies, pregnancy or postpartum, infection, HIV, malignancy, and drugs such as quinine, clopidogrel, and calcineurin inhibitors.

differentials.hint: Kidney predominant; often after Shiga toxin diarrhea in children.

differentials.name: Disseminated intravascular coagulation
differentials.hint: Prolonged PT and PTT, low fibrinogen, high D-dimer.

tricks: Mnemonic FAT RN: Fever, microangiopathic hemolytic Anemia, Thrombocytopenia, Renal injury, Neurologic signs.
Normal PT and PTT separates TTP or HUS from DIC.
exam_appearance: Woman with confusion, petechiae, anemia, schistocytes, and normal PT and PTT; start plasma exchange.
Postpartum patient with microangiopathic hemolysis and neurologic findings; ADAMTS13 activity low: TTP.
treatment: Rituximab for refractory or relapsing disease; caplacizumab can reduce early events.
red_flags: Delay in plasma exchange increases mortality.
Platelet transfusion can worsen thrombosis; reserve for life-threatening hemorrhage.
algorithm: Suspect TTP in microangiopathic hemolytic anemia plus thrombocytopenia; check PT and PTT.
If normal, treat as TTP (PLEX plus steroids) and send ADAMTS13 tests.
If PT or PTT prolonged and fibrinogen low, evaluate for DIC.

cases.stem: 34-year-old woman with petechiae, confusion, and dark urine.
cases.teaching: Start plasma exchange promptly; do not wait for assays.

cases.stem: Postpartum patient with fluctuating aphasia and renal injury.
cases.teaching: Pregnancy and postpartum can precipitate inhibitory ADAMTS13 deficiency.
